org.forgerock.openidm.config.manage

Class ConfigObjectService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openidm.config.manage.ConfigObjectService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler

    @Properties(value={@Property(name="service.description",value="OpenIDM Configuration Service"),@Property(name="service.vendor",value="ForgeRock AS."),@Property(name="openidm.router.prefix",value="/config*")})
@Service
public class ConfigObjectService
extends Object
implements org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler
    Provides access to OSGi configuration

      • read

        public Map<String,Object> read(org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceName resourceName)
                        throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Gets an object from the object set by identifier.

        The object may contain metadata properties, including object identifier _id, and object version _rev to enable optimistic concurrency supported by OpenIDM.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - the identifier of the resource to retrieve from the object set.
        Returns:
        the requested object.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • handleCreate

        public void handleCreate(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.CreateRequest request,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.ResultHandler<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> handler)
        Specified by:
        handleCreate in interface org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler

      • create

        public void create(org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceName resourceName,
          String id,
          Map<String,Object> obj)
            throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Creates a new object in the object set.

        This method sets the _id property to the assigned identifier for the object, and the _rev property to the revised object version (For optimistic concurrency)

        Parameters:
        resourceName - for multi-instance config, the factory pid to use
        id - the client-generated identifier to use, or null if server-generated identifier is requested.
        obj - the contents of the object to create in the object set.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified id could not be resolved.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or object set is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if an object with the same ID already exists.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • handleUpdate

        public void handleUpdate(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.UpdateRequest request,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.ResultHandler<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> handler)
        Specified by:
        handleUpdate in interface org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler

      • update

        public void update(org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceName resourceName,
          String rev,
          Map<String,Object> obj)
            throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Updates the specified object in the object set.

        This implementation requires MVCC and hence enforces that clients state what revision they expect to be updating

        If successful, this method updates metadata properties within the passed object, including: a new _rev value for the revised object's version

        Parameters:
        resourceName - the identifier of the resource to be updated
        rev - the version of the object to update; or null if not provided.
        obj - the contents of the object to put in the object set.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if version is required but is null.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • handleDelete

        public void handleDelete(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.DeleteRequest request,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.ResultHandler<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> handler)
        Specified by:
        handleDelete in interface org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler

      • delete

        public void delete(org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceName resourceName,
          String rev)
            throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Deletes the specified object from the object set.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - the identifier of the resource to be deleted.
        rev - the version of the object to delete or null if not provided.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if version is required but is null.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
